abstract: Weinstein Company, distributors of Quentin Tarantino’s film The Hateful Eight, completes difficult task of preparing projection equipment theaters will need to show 70-millimeter movie when it is released in December; format, widely used in 1950s and 1960s and prized for its subtle aesthetic effects, needs modified film projectors, technology now considered obsolete.
lead_paragraph: The film will be released in a special roadshow version — with overture, intermission and additional footage — on 100 screens in 70-millimeter projection.

headline.main: Tarantino’s ‘The Hateful Eight’ Resurrects Nearly Obsolete Technology
headline.print_headline: In a World Gone Digital, Room for a Lost Format

snippet: The film will be released in a special roadshow version — with overture, intermission and additional footage — on 100 screens in 70-millimeter projection.
